lead_paragraph: PHILIP--Tania Kaiulani, age 52, died of complications from Amyloidosis on April 27, 2016 in her home in Bronxville, New York, where she lived with her husband Michael Siberry and daughter Chloe Siberry. Born March 18, 1964 in Honolulu, Hawaii to Dr. Alistair G.S. Philip, MD and the late Elin M. Roberts. Tania trained at the National Ballet School in Toronto and danced with the Hamburg Ballet (Germany), Joffrey Ballet, N.Y.C. Opera Ballet and Broadway's Phantom of the Opera. She graduated Magna cum Laude from Columbia University with a B.A. in English Literature and became Senior Vice President of the PR firm WEILL, where she headed media campaigns in South America, Europe, Africa, Middle and Far East. She is survived by her husband and daughter, her father Dr. Alistair G.S. Philip, stepmother Louise Holcumb, sister Katrina, brother-in-law and niece. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  PHILIP, TANIA KAIULANI
